name: Abhik Gorai
bio: Abhik Gorai began his career as Engineer in reputed telecom industries like Huawei Telecommunication and Alcatel Lucent India pvt ltd. After completing his Masters in Technology, he began his teaching career. Besides teaching, he actively contributes to various workshops and conferences organized in the university. His research interest lies in the field of fractal antenna design for various application which leads to periodic publication in some reputed journals like IEEE, Elsevier etc.

name: Abu Nasar Ghazali
bio:
Abu Nasar Ghazali received his B.Tech. degree in Electronics & Communication Engineering (ECE) from SRM University, Chennai, in 2008 and M.E. degree in Microwave Engineering from Birla Institute of Technology (BIT) Mesra, in 2010 where he was a GATE scholar. He completed his doctorate in 2014 from BIT
Mesra. He worked as an Assistant Professor (I) in the Department of ECE at the BIT Mesra, Patna campus. Currently, he is an Assistant Professor (II) in the School of Electronics Engineering, at the Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KiiT), Deemed University, Bhubaneswar, India. 
He is an Associate member, The Institution of Engineers (IEI), India and member of IEEE. He has published quite a few papers in SCI/SCOPUS indexed journals and conferences. His main research interests are UWB filters, Microstrip filters, and passive microwave circuit components.

name: Akshaya Kumar Pati
bio:
Akshaya Kumar Pati received the BTech degree in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering from BPUT, Odisha
He received the  Mtech degree from MNNIT, Allahabad with specialisation on Cotrol and Instrumentation Engineering.
He obtained PhD degree from IIT Bhubaneswar with specialization on Single stage grid connected PV system and their control.  
His research interests on control issues on grid integrated renewable sources, fast charging station of electric vehicle

name: Amit Bakshi
bio:
Amit Bakshi received the B.Tech.degree in Electronics and Communication Engineering from Asansol Engineering College,WB and M.Tech. degree in VLSI Design from VIT University, Vellore. He is currently working as an Assistant Professor since 2014 in the School of Electronics Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, where he is currently pursuing the Ph.D. degree. His research interests are in Low power Digital Integrated Circuit design, FPGA base system design, ASIC design,  Biomedical imaging, Digital signal processing and its application.
He has an expertise in various technology tools like Virtuoso (Cadence) Design Suite, NC-Verilog Simulator, Ncsim, RTL Compiler, ALTERA, ModelSim, Xilinx, Vivado,   MATLAB etc.

name: Amitkumar V. Jha
bio: Amitkumar V. Jha has completed his Bachelor of Engineering degree in 2012 from University of Pune and he has received his Master degree (M.Tech) in 2015 from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, India. He has a great interest in Internet of Things, network coding, wireless communication networks: standards and protocols. Currently, he is holding a post of assistant professor in the School of Electronics Engineering (since June 2015) at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), DU, India.

name: Amlan Datta
bio: Amlan Datta has completed his B. Tech in Electronics and Electrical Communication. M. Tech in Microwave and Radar Engineering and Ph. D in Electronics from IIT Kharagpur in the year 1987, 1989 and 1992, respectively. During his Ph. D work, he published 6 papers in leading journal viz., IEEE Microwave Theory and Technique, IEE Proceeding Part H, etc. After completion of his Ph. D work he has worked in DRDO sponsored project and as Scientist in Defense Electronics Applications Laboratory for 5 years. He has worked in Reliance Communication for 12 years and rolled out and maintained GSM and CDMA network last as Wireless Lead, Kolkata. He has worked in ZTE Telecom India as Technical Head for 3 years and rolled out and maintained WCDMA network for Reliance Communication. For last 6 years he is working as Professor and Associate Dean, School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT, Deemed to be university. He has guided 2 Ph. D students, 25 M. Tech students and more than 100 B. Tech students during this period. He published 30 Scopus indexed papers.

name: Anupam Samui
bio: has 10 years of experience in teaching. He mostly teaches the undergraduate students. Subjects he taught are Basic Electronics, Digital Electronics, Communication Theory, Wireless and Mobile Communication etc. Has reviewed a book on Digital Electronics also. He graduated from Leeds University (MSc) in Wireless Communication. His research interest is in Communication and Bio Medical science.

name: Anupama Senapati
bio: Anupama Senapati has 7 years teaching and research experience. She is currently working as Asst. Prof. at KIIT Deemed to be University since June 2012. She has completed her PhD in Antenna Signal Processing in the year 2016. Her research interest includes Antenna Array, Signal Processing, Microwave and Millimeter Wave Filters. She has published 17 papers in International Journals  and 7 papers in International Conferences. She has been a part of committee member of various international conferences and Reviewer of many international journals. She is a life member of ISTE, ISC and IEEE.

name: Arighna Deb
bio: Arighna Deb has received BE in Electronics and Communication from Visveswaraiah Technological University, India and MTech with specialization in VLSI from West Bengal University of Technology, India. He has received two PhD degrees- one from the Jadavpur University, India and the other one from University of Bremen, Germany. His research interests include design and synthesis of quantum circuits and quantum architectures, automatic place and route of Quantum-dot Cellular Automata, Optical circuit design.

name: Arindam Basak
bio: "Arindam Basak has 7+ years of experience in education and teaching. He had completed his graduation from the University of Kalyani, West Bengal and after that completed his post-graduation from Jadavpur University, West Bengal. He has completed his doctoral degree from the Indian Institute of Engineering Science and Technology, Shibpur, West Bengal. His main research interest is Thin-film photovoltaics, sensor technology. He has authored a number of national and international journals. He is teaching courses on Control Systems, Power Plant Instrumentation, Measurement and Instrumentation, Basic Electronics, Electrical and Electronics Measurement, Analytical Instrumentation, Industrial Automation and Control. Apart from being a faculty, He is also the Associate Dean of Training and Placement for his department."

name: Arun Kumar Ray
bio: Prof. Arun Kumar Ray is currently working as Professor, School of Electronics Engineering, and KIIT Deemed to be University. He is acting as Dean of the School since 2013. He is now involved both in teaching and administration. He has completed his Ph.D. from IIT Kharagpur. He has been with KIIT for the last 21 years. He has delivered many invited/keynotes talks at International & National Conferences/ Workshops/Seminars. He has published many research papers in peer-reviewed international/national journals and conferences. He is also having active memberships of IEEE Signal Processing, IET and lifetime member of ISTE, During his teaching professional he had taught subjects like digital signal processing, advanced digital signal processing, digital image processing, Computational Intelligence, Computer Networking. He has successfully guided many Ph.D. and M.Tech students and also examined several doctoral dissertations. His research interest includes Image processing and Computer networks

name: Ayaskanta Mishra
bio: Ayaskanta Mishra is pursuing Teaching and Research since 2011. Prior to his teaching career he was working as Engineering at SIEMENS Communications & Enterprise Networks India part of SIEMENS AG. He is currently active in research Communication Engineering & Next-Generation Networks. His area of interest includes Network & protocols optimization, Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS), Internet of Things (IoT), AR/VR, UI/UX, Sensor data analytics, WSN, Network Security, Internet technologies, optimization techniques using AI and Machine learning. He has numerous indexed Journals and international/national conference proceedings to his credits. He is having rich experience on different network tools NS-2, QualNet, CISCO Packet Tracer, protocol analyzers and embedded development platforms like Arduino, Raspberry Pi, Intel Galileo, XBEE Zigbee motes for developing of IoT application prototypes for Smart Cities, Healthcare, Supply Chain Management, Environment and Agriculture. He has undergone various industry training and associations with Wipro Mission 10X professional trainer program, D-Link Certified Network Trainer, Intel FiCE certified trainer for IoT, Ericsson Trainer in Media & Applications. He is associated with Training Programs from Cypress Semiconductors and Microchip in the domain of Embedded Systems and IoT. Prof. Mishra is giving training and consultancy service to budding engineers and corporate on Computer Networks & IoT. He has received his Bachelor in Engineering degree with Distinction from SATHYABAMA Deemed to be University (Chennai) in the year 2007 and Masters in Technology from IIIT in year 2011. He is currently pursuing Ph.D in Communication Networks and IoT. He is professional society member IET (UK) since 2017 and a life member ISCA.

name: Bhargav Appasani
bio: Bhargav Appasani has completed hid Ph.D. from Birla Institue of Technology. He has over three years of teaching experience. He has published over 25 articles in reputed international journals and conferences. He is the reviewer for IEEE Transactions on Smart Grid, IEEE Acess, etc. His research interests include reliability analysis, Smart grid communication and Terahertz circuits.

name: Bikash Kumar Behera
bio: Bikash Kumar Behera  has 5 years of experience working as Assistant Prof. in KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubneswar. He also worked as Assistant Prof. in  JRE Group of Institution, Greater Noida. He postgraduate major in Telecom Technology from IIT Delhi and earned  his B.Tech degree in Electronics and Telecommunication form NIT Raipur.

name: Bishnu Prasad De
bio: Bishnu Prasad De received his B.Tech degree in Electronics & Communication Engineering from Jalpaiguri Government Engineering College, West Bengal, India, in 2007; M.Tech degree in VLSI Design from IIEST Shibpur, West Bengal, India in 2009 and Ph.D degree in Microelectronics and VLSI Technology from National Institute of Technology Durgapur, West Bengal, India  in 2016. He worked as an Assistant Professor at Haldia Institute of Technology, West Bengal, India for more than seven years. In 2017, he joined  at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India and currently serves as an Assistant Professor (II). His research interests includes Nano-scale device modeling and characterization, Analog and Mixed Signal IC Design, RF Integrated Circuit Design.

name: Budhadeb Maity
bio: Dr. Budhadeb Maity is currently working as an Assistant Professor [II] at School of Electronics Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT University), Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. Budhadeb has received his doctoral degree (PhD) from Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Guwahati under the supervision of Prof. Sisir Kumar Nayak in 2023. He completed his Master’s degree from Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur, WB in 2012 in the specialization of RF and Microwave Engineering and Bachelor’s degree (Electronics and Telecommunication Engg) from BPUT, Rourkela, Odisha, India in 2004.  He has more than 10 years of teaching and research experiences. His research interests broadly include Microstrip Antenna Design, (UWB IBW, CP, Wideband Harmonic Suppression and ML), Antenna Array.

name: Deep Mukherjee
bio: Deep Mukherjee began his career in education as an Assistant Professor under School of Electronics Engineering  in Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology(KIIT) Deemed to be University in 2012. He has six years of experience in teaching and two years of experience in industry. He teaches Industrial Automation & Control, Fiber Optics Instrumentation, Instrumentation- I & II, Biomedical Instrumentation, Process Control, Control System, Electrical & Electronics Measurement, Analog Electronics and Digital Electronics. He holds a bachelor’s degree (B.E) in Applied Electronics & Instrumentation Engineering from Burdwan University and a master’s degree (M.TECH) in Instrumentation & Control Engineering from Calcutta University. He is a member of The Institution of Engineering & Technology(MIET) UK and recently  has been also playing role as reviewer in a Scopus indexed journal. His research interest includes development of fractional order controllers for nonlinear process, nonlinear controller, optimization techniques. He has been also presenter at conferences on his research article. He is involved under departmental committee member for accreditation process. He organized two days workshop on Soft Computing Techniques in Engineering Applications. He organized two days workshop on Process Instrumentation Technologies in collaboration with IET kolkata local network. He played a role as publicity chair in an International Conference CINE. He conducted one day seminar on Sensor & Sensing Technologies. He Played role as an organizing committee member also in 6th WCASET. Recently he also organized one day workshop on Process Dynamics Control & Applications in association with IET Kolkata network. He has been guiding B.TECH level projects and under his guidance a group of students won best project in State level during Engineering Students Innovation Challenge(ESIC).

name: Ganaraj P S
bio: Ganaraj P S , an Assistant Professor (I) in School of Electronics Engineering from 2017 has an BE Degree in Electrical Engineering from PES Mandya and MTech Degree in Microelectronics from Manipal Institute of Technology, Manipal. He has overall experience of 6 years. His research interests are in MEMS(Micro Electro Mechanical Systems), MEMS Resonators, MEMS Switches and its applications.

name: Israj Ali

He has taught Signals & Systems, Digital Signal Processing, Digital Electronics Circuits, Communication Engineering, Analog Electronics. He holds a bachelor's degree in Electronics and Communication Engineering and did his Master of Science from Electronics and Electrical Department, IIT Kharagpur.

name: Jabir Hussain
bio: Jabir Hussain has been an Assistant Professor at KIIT University since 2016. He had completed his masters in RF and Microwave from IIT Kharagpur, having earned his B.E. from Assam Engineering College, Guwahati. His research interests include ultra-wideband antennas, lossy filters and mixed signal design.

name: Jyoti Ranjan Panda
bio: Jyoti Ranjan PANDA received his B.Tech degree in Electrical Engineering from the College of Engineering and Technology, Bhubaneswar in 1999, M. E. degree in Communication Engineering from BITS, Pilani, and Rajasthan in 2001. He completed his Ph.D from Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati in October 2012. Prior to that he was senior research fellow (SRF) in a BRNS, DAE funded project “Development of Preforms from High Power Fiber Lasers” in Department of Physics and Meteorology, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur (May 2002 to March 2004), faculty in Durgapur Institute of Advanced Technology (DIATM), Durgapur, West Bengal, National Institute of Science and Technology (NIST), Berhampur, Odisha. He was serving as an Assistant Professor from June 2012 to November 2012 and from November 2012 to till now he is serving as an Associate Professor in School of Electronics Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (Deemed to be University), Bhubaneswar, Odisha. His research interest is in microwave Engineering, planar antennas for wireless communication. Now he is started working in the field of adaptive and array signal processing.

name: Manas Ranjan Tripathy
bio:
Dr. Manas Ranjan Tripathy has more than 16 years of experience in teaching and research. He started his academic career as a lecturer in the Department of Instrumentation and Electronics Engineering, OUTR, Bhubaneswar (Formerly known as CET, Bhubaneswar) in the year 2008. Later, he joined SOA University, Bhubaneswar in 2010. He earned his PhD from the Indian Institute of Technology, Banaras Hindu University, Varanasi in 2020. Before joining KIIT University, he worked as an Assistant Professor there at SRM University, AP. 
Dr Manas has authored and co-authored 40 research articles in various peer-reviewed journals and conference proceedings including 3 papers in IEEE Transactions and one Nature Indexed journal. He was invited by many institutions to deliver talks related to the VLSI domain. Dr. Manas has also received best paper awards at IEEE Conferences. He also served as a reviewer in many international journals and conferences. Dr. Manas Ranjan Tripathy, Assistant Professor-II in the School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University has participated in many INUP programs held at IISc, Bangalore related to the fabrication and characterization of nanoscale devices.

name: Manoj Kumar Beuria
bio: Working as an Assistant professor in KIIT University, Odisha, INDIA. He received his B.Tech degree in electronics and communication engineering from National institute of technology (NIT) Rourkela. Received his M.Tech degree in electronics and communication from Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Roorkee. And currently pursuing his PHD from KIIT University. He has more than seven years of teaching experience and more than two years of industry experience. He teaches Digital Signal Processing (Dsp), Communication system, Information theory And Coding, Signals And Systems , and mobile communication. Now he is doing research in 5G Communication, Wireless Sensor Network, IOT And Machine Learning.

name: Nirmal K. Rout
bio: Prof. Rout has twenty six years of experience in academic and research area in different national repute institutions. He has won the Best Faculty Award of the KIIT University on January 26, 2016. He is also certificated Mission10X Learning Approach Practitioners from Wipro Ltd. He has received the B.E. from UCE (presently known as VSSUT), Burla, M. Tech. from the Utkal University, Bhubaneswar, and Ph.D. from KIIT University, Bhubaneswar in 1991, 2001 and 2014 respectively. From 1991 to 1993, he was a Lecturer with the Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, GIET, Bhubaneswar. From 1993 to 2002, he was a Lecturer with the Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, OEC, Bhubaneswar. He also served as a Faculty Member of ICFAITech, Hyderabad from 2002 to 2007. He is currently working as a Professor with the School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar. He has published a number of research papers in various refereed international journals and conferences. His current research interest includes active noise control, adaptive signal processing, image processing, soft computing and evolutionary computing.

tab_details.Research Interests: active noise control, adaptive signal processing, image processing, soft computing and evolutionary computing

name: Om Prakash Acharya
bio: Dr. Om Prakash Acharya received his Ph.D. in Electronics and Communication Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee, India in 2016. Since 2016, he has been an Assistant Professor with School of Electronics, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar, India.  His research interest deals with antenna arrays, array signal processing, smart antennas and application of biologically inspired computational techniques.

name: Pravin Kumar Samanta
bio: Prof. Pravin Kumar Samanta has been working as an Assistant Professor since mid of 2017, in School of Electronics Engineering Department at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Deemed to be University in Bhubaneswar. He did his B.Sc Honors in Physics with a first class degree from Rama Krishna Mission Residential College at Narendrapur, Kolkata (affiliated to Calcutta University). At graduate level he was awarded Scholarship for Higher Education (SHE) under the prestigious program, Innovation in Science Pursuit for Inspired Research (INSPIRE) conducted by the DST, Govt. of India. He holds B.Tech degree in Radio Physics and Electronics from the Institute of Radio Physics and Electronics under Calcutta University and pursued his M.Tech with specialization in VLSI Design from Calcutta University. He has two years research experience in VLSI domain under Special Manpower Development Project, 2016-17 (SMDP C2SD Project, by DeitY, Government of India). He has more than five years of teaching & research experiences. Currently he is perusing his Ph.D. in KIIT Deemed to be University in the area of Biomedical Image Processing. His research areas are mainly focused on Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Biomedical Signal & Image Processing and FPGA Design. Besides Technological knowledge, he has a deep thrust for research in Science and Spirituality, Cosmology, Vedic wisdom and Indian Culture.

name: Priya Das
bio: Prof. Priya Das has been working as an Assistant Professor in the School of Electronics Engineering at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (Deemed to be University) at Bhubaneswar since 2018. She holds a Bachelor of Technology degree with a specialization in Electronics and Communication Engineering from Kalyani Government Engineering College under the West Bengal University of Technology. She has three years of work experience in Tata Consultancy Services – EIS (Engineering and Industrial Services). She completed her M.Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering from IIT Bhubaneswar and worked in the field of Biomedical Signal Processing using Machine Learning Techniques.  Currently, she is perusing her Ph.D. in the area of biomedical image processing. Her research areas are Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Signal Processing, and Image Processing.

name: Rasmita Lenka
bio: Dr. Rasmita Lenka has over 18 years of experience in technical education. She began her career as a teaching professional and has gained extensive expertise in Analog & Digital Communication, Optical Communication, and Industry 4.0. Over the years, she has also been an active contributor to various departmental activities and served as a Programme Officer in NSS, reflecting her commitment to academic as well as social responsibilities. She earned her B.Tech in 2004, followed by an M.Tech from VSSUT, Burla, and a Ph.D. from KIIT Deemed University in the field of Image Processing. Her research interests include Image Processing, Signal Processing,Biomedical Engineering and Communication, where she continues to contribute through her scholarly work. Her teaching methodology emphasizes a numerical and concept-oriented approach, which has been widely appreciated and valued by her students for its clarity and effectiveness.

name: Rishi Kumar Khanna
bio: Prof. Rishi Kumar Khanna has 6+ years of teaching and research experience. He is currently doing research in the domain of Analog RF integrated circuits, Analog circuits and systems and Power electronics. Prof. R K Khanna has experience of different circuit simulation platforms like Cadence OrCAD PSpice, NI Multisim and also experience of embedded development platforms like Cypress Semiconductor's PSoC Creator for PSoC Arduino for development of IoT application prototypes for different applications like Smart Consumer systems, Smart warehousing, Environment and Smart Irrigation. He has undergone Short Term Training Programs (STTPs) from Cypress Semiconductors in the domain of Embedded Systems and IoT with certificates: Cypress Certificate in PSoC Design Level-1.

tab_details.Research Interests: RF and Microwave Communications, Analog RF integrated circuits, Analog circuits and systems, Power Electronics, Power supplies, Mixed-signal circuits, Machine Learning

name: Sananda Kumar

Tech degree from KIIT, Odisha, India 2011, and completed Ph.D. degree in Electronics and Communication engineering from NIT Rourkela, Odisha, India in 2017. He is currently Assistant Professor in School of Electronics Engineering at KIIT deemed to be University, Odisha, India. His current research interest is distributed signal processing, robust statistics.

name: Sasmita Pahadsingh
bio: Dr. Sasmita Pahadsingh, is an Assistant professor in School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India.  She has completed her M.Tech in communication system engineering and PhD degree in antenna from KIIT University. Her research interests include integrated antenna design, frequency reconfigurable antenna design and MIMO antenna for cognitive radio application. She has more than 15 years of teaching and research experience and has published more than 15 papers published in peer reviewed journals and conference proceedings. She is a member of IEEE, ISTE and Indian Science Congress.

name: Shruti
bio: Since 2019, Shruti has held the position of Assistant Professor in the School of Electronics Engineering at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, a deemed university located in Bhubaneshwar. She earned her Bachelor of Technology degree, specializing in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering, from the same institution in 2015. Prior to her academic tenure, she gained 8 months of experience as a software trainee at Aricent. Continuing her academic journey, she pursued and completed her M.Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering at IIT Bhubaneswar, 2019 where her focus was on research in wireless communication.In 2024, Shruti successfully defended her PhD thesis at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology. Titled “Design of Metamaterial Based Terahertz Absorber For Refractive Index Sensing,” her doctoral work underscores her proficiency in the field. Her research interests encompass wireless communication, THz technology, and metamaterial absorbers. With a publication record exceeding 10 contributions in reputable international journals and conferences, she has made notable contributions to advancing knowledge in her areas of expertise.

name: Srinivas Ramavath
bio: Mr. Srinivas Ramavath received the B.Tech degree in Electronics and Communications Engineering from the JB Institute of Engineering and Technology (JBIET) is approved by All India Council for Technical Education and affiliated with Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University, Hyderabad, India, in 2009 and M.Tech degree in Wireless Communication Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Guwahati, in 2012. From 2009 to 20010, he worked as a Software Engineer with the MNC, Hyderabad. He joined the Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneswar as a faculty member in 2012. His research areas are in wireless communications, 4G and 5G Technologies, Cognitive Radio and signal processing. He has authored or co-authored over 6 international conference papers in the areas of his research interests.

name: Subhrakanta Behera
bio: Dr. Subhrakanta Behera was born in Odisha, India. He received the B.Sc. Degree from Utkal University in 1995, the M.Sc. Degree from Berhampur University in 1997, the M. Tech. Degree from Cochin University of Science and Technology, Kochi, Kerala, in 2004, and the Ph.D. Degree from Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-12, India, in 2011, under the guidance of Prof. K. J. Vinoy. He spent a year as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow at the GE Global Research Centre, Bangalore. He is currently an Associate Professor - I in the School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. His research interest is in the field of computational electromagnetic, RF and microwave engineering, Microwave antenna, Nano Fabrication and RF MEMS. He is the author or coauthor of 15 papers and articles published in international conferences and scientific journals.

name: Subir Kumar Maity
bio: Subir Kr. Maity has more than twelve years of academic experience. He has completed Ph.D. from the Institute of Radio Physics and Electronics, University of Calcutta, in the area of Nano-scale MOS transistors with III-V compound semiconductors as channel material.  He has completed his M.Tech in specialization of VLSI Design and Microelectronics Technology from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, West Bengal. He is also the winner of the gold medal for securing 1st position in the M.Tech VLSI specialization. His search interests are compact modeling of sub-micron MOSFET, MOS transistors with high mobility channel material, quantum well MOSFET, Negative Capacitance FETs, Artificial Neural network based compact model development, etc.

name: Sudhakar Sahu
bio: Sudhakar Sahu is presently working as Professor, School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He received ME degree in Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering from Indian Institute of Engineering Science & Technology (IIEST) Shibpur, West Bengal & PhD (Engineering) degree in Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering from Jadavpur University, Kolkata. He is the author and co-author of 60 articles in International Journals & Conference Proceedings. He has supervised 4 doctoral theses. He has successfully completed two Govt. Of India funded projects: one is AICTE, New Delhi and another BRNS-DAE, Mumbai. His research interests and activities include Dielectric Resonator based MIMO Antenna for Cognitive Radios, UWB Antenna, Microstrip Filters, Metamaterial/Metasurface based microwave components & application of Soft Computing Techniques in Engineering. He is a Senior Member of IEEE AP/MTT Society, Fellow IE (India), Member IET (UK) & Life Member ISTE (New Delhi).

name: Sudhansu Sekhar Singh
bio: Dr. Sudhansu Sekhar Singh has received a PhD in Engineering (Wireless Communication) from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India and a M.E. in Electronic System and Communication Engineering from R.E.C (presently NIT) Rourkela, India. He is working as a Professor in School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar, India. He has more than 18 years of teaching experience and 8 years of other professional experience. More than 75(seventy five) publications in International journals and reputed international conference proceedings are to his credit. Also he has guided more than twenty five PG thesis and Three doctoral thesis. He has also examined several doctoral dissertations. His broad research area includes but not certainly limited to wireless and mobile communication, multicarrier CDMA, MIMO-OFDM,Wireless Sensor Networks.

name: Sukanta Kumar Sabut
bio:
Sukant Sabut received the B.E. and M. Tech. degrees in Electronics Engineering from the VT University of Karnataka in 2005 and the Ph. D. degree in Medical Science and Technology from IIT Kharagpur, India, in 2011. From 1997 to 2007, he was a rehabilitation engineer in JSS Medical College and Hospital, Mysore. From 2013 to 2017, he was an Associate Professor of the Electronics Engineering Department, ITER, SOA University, Odisha. Presently working as a Associate Professor in School of Electronics Engineering,KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. Sabut is a member of IEEE, IET, IFESS, Rehabilitation Council of India, Biomedical Engineering Society of India, and the Institution of Engineers (India). He is the author of 82 articles in journals and conferences. He has over 20 years of
experience in both teaching and research. He has guided 05 Ph.D and many M.Tech students. His research interests include biomedical signal and image analysis, Machine learning and neural and rehabilitation engineering. Edited Book: Sabut S.K. ,  Ray A.K. ,  Pati B. ,  Acharya U.R. Proc. of International Conference on Communication, Circuits, and Systems: IC3S 2020: Lecture Notes in Electrical Engineering , 2021, 728.

name: Suman Roy
bio:
I am working as an Assistant Professor in the School of Electronics Engineering at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar since July 2018.  I am a Ph.D. Scholar (presently in part-time category) in the Department of Electronics and Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati. My research interest includes Feedback Shift Register (FSR) sequences, Pseudo-random Number Generators (PRNGs), MIMO-LFSR. 
I completed my B.Tech. in Instrumentation and Control Engineering from the Calcutta Institute of Engineering and Management in 2010. Then, I finished my M.E. in Nuclear Engineering from Jadavpur University, Kolkata in 2012. I worked at National Institute of Science and Technology, Odisha for six months (July 2012-Dec2012) as an Assistant Professor in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering Department. After that, I joined the Ph.D. programme of IIT Guwahati in December 2012.

name: Sunil Kumar Mishra
bio: Sunil Kumar Mishra received the Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering from Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad, India. He is working as an Assistant Professor with the School of Electronics Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He previously worked as Assistant Professor with the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College, Ghaziabad, India. His research interests include Control Systems, Ocean Wave Energy, Nonlinear Controller Design.

name: Suprava Patnaik
bio: Suprava Patnaik received B.Sc Engg and M.Sc Engg degrees from NIT, Rourkela and awarded with PhD from E & ECE Dept., IIT, Kharagpur. She has nearly 100 publications in SCI & Scopus indexed journals and conferences to her credit. She has 30 years of teaching and research experience. She has served as faculty at NIT, Rourkela, SVNIT, Surat and XIE, Mumbai. She also worked as guest lecturer and bigdata research associate in University of Western Australia, Perth, during 2015-2017. She has successfully guided 9-PhD scholars leading to award of degrees.

name: Swati Swayamsiddha
bio: Swati Swayamsiddha has been working in the School of Electronics Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India since 2009. Her areas of interest includes mobile communications, adaptive signal processing, cognitive radio networks, bio-inspired optimization, soft and evolutionary computing, Cognitive IoT and Next Generation Wireless Communication.

name: Tejaswini Kar
bio: Tejaswini Kar received her B. Tech degree in electronics and telecommunication engineering from B.P.U.T. in 2003, received her M. Tech degree in communication system engineering from KIIT deemed to be university in 2008 and PhD degree in electronics and telecommunication engineering in 2018 from KIIT deemed to be university, Bhubaneswar, India. She has a total of 14 years of teaching experience. From 2004 to 2008, she was a lecturer with the Department of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering, College of Engineering, Bhubaneswar. She is currently an Assistant Professor with the School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT deemed to be University. She has published ten research papers in refereed international conferences and journals. Her current research interests include signal processing, image processing, video processing and CBIR systems.

name: Udai P Singh
bio:
Udai P Singh has nearly 25 years of experience in teaching and research. After completing his Ph D from Banaras Hindu University, Varanasi (1993), he joined Global Solar Energy (India) Ltd, Gurgaon to work on the process development and production of CdTe based thin film solar cells. During that period he also got the training at First Solar Inc. USA. In 2000 he joined the Institute of Energy Conversion, University of Delaware, USA as Limited Time Researcher and worked on the processes development of flexible CIGS based thin film solar cells. He joined KIIT in December 2002 as a faulty and currently he is Sr.  Prof in the School. During his stay at KIIT he has been invited as Visiting Consultant to Industrial Technological Research Institute (ITRI), Hsinchu, Taiwan in 2008 and 2009. Dr Singh has developed a good research facility in the area of thin film PV from several research funding form DST, DRDO, MNRE etc .
Dr. Udai P Singh, Sr. Professor in the School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University has participated and completed the Leadership Academician Program sponsored by MHRD, Govt of India from 23rd Sept to 5th October 2019 at Banaras Hindu University (BHU), Varanasi and from 7th Oct. to 12th October 2019 at Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Singapore. In all,  25 participants were selected from all over India to participate in this program

name: Umesh Chandra Samal
bio: Umesh Chandra Samal received his B. E. degree in Electrical Engineering from VSSUT, Sambalpur, India in 2003 and the M. Tech. degree in Electronic System and Communication Engineering from National Institute of Technology (NIT), Rourkela, India in 2006. He obtained his Ph. D. degree from the department of Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Kanpur, India in February, 2015. He has 3 years of industry and more than 4 years of teaching experience. His area of interest is Signal Processing, Wireless Communication, 4G and 5G wireless communication Technologies, Statistical Signal Processing, Cognitive Radio and Wireless Sensor Networks.

name: Vikas Kumar Jha
bio:
Dr. Vikas has received his doctoral degree from Indira Gandhi Centre for Atomic Research, Department of Atomic Energy, (HBNI-BARC Mumbai), India. In his doctoral research, he has designed and developed Programmable System on Chip (PSoC) based Weld Pattern Analyzer (WPA) system for real-time monitoring of arc welding process. 
His area of research primarily focuses on Interdisciplinary application of Signal Processing, Embedded system and Charcoal Electronics. Dr. Jha has over six years of teaching/research experience. Currently, he is also working on the project “Charcoal Based Low-Cost Smart Sensor for Agriculture Application” sponsored by the department of agriculture, government of Orissa.

name: Vimal K. Shrivastava
bio: Dr. Vimal K. Shrivastava has received his BE degree in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering from the Chhattisgarh Swami Vivekanand Technical University, Bhilai, Chhattisgarh in 2009 and MTech degree in Electronics Instrumentation Engineering from National Institute of Technology Warangal, Andhra Pradesh in 2011. Later, he received his PhD degree from National Institute of Technology, Raipur, India in 2016. He is currently working as an Assistant Professor in the School of Electronics Engineering of Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Bhubaneswar, India. His area of research includes Image processing, soft computing techniques, machine learning, active learning and deep learning. He has published many papers in SCI and SCOPUS indexed journals and international conferences on the aforementioned research areas.

name: Wriddhi Bhowmik
bio: He has 5 years teaching experiences. He did his ME and PhD thesis in the field of RF & Microwave Engineering. His research area was Butler matrix array, SIW, EBG, Microstrip patch antenna and other passive devices. He worked as Assistant Professor at Raj KUmar Goel Institute of Technology, Ghaziabad UP for 2 years as well as at Haldia Institute of Technology, Haldi, WB for 3 years. Joined KIIT, Deemed to be University on June 2018. He taught UG subjects like, Analog Communication, Digital Communication, Control System, Signal & System and Wireless Communication. Heknows to operate different EM simulation softwares like SONNET, ADS, HFSS as well as measurement instruments like VNA, Spectrum Analyzer. He also knows the chemical pholithography process of PCB fabrication. Upon completion of PhD, he is continuously working on his research career and also written some project proposals to the organizations like Department of Science & Technology, Govt. of West Bengal (WBDST) and  Department of Science & Technology, Govt. of India (Young Scientists Scheme) for funding, so that can set up a well equipped laboratory and work independently. His impeccable outlook of learning, problem solving capability and his tireless effort during Master's and PhD thesis work as well as in teaching put a significant contribution in his professional development and these are admirable.

name: Sumit Dass 2
bio: Sumit Dass received the B.E. degree in electronics and telecommunication engineering from Government Engineering College, Raipur, in 2008, and the M.Tech. degree in laser and electro-optics from Defence Institute of Advanced Technology, Pune, India, in 2011. He completed his Ph.D. in optical fiber sensing from Indian Institute of Technology, Bhubaneswar in 2019. He is currently working as Asst. Prof.-I in the School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT Bhubaneswar. His current research interests include the fabrication and design of optical microfiber-based curvature and acoustic sensors.

name: Trutpi Mayee Behera
bio: T. M. Behera got her B.Tech degree in Electronics & Communication Engineering from NIST, Berhampur under Biju Pattnaik University of Technology(BPUT) in 2007. She received her M.Tech in Communication System from KIIT University in 2012. She started her teaching career as Lecturer in Electronics and Telecommunication Department in ABIT, Cuttack under BPUT. She has 10 years of teaching experience and is currently working as an Assistant Professor in School of Electronics at KIIT University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Her research area broadly includes Wireless Sensor Networks and its application in IoT

name: V V Subrahmanya Kumar Bhajana
bio: VeeraVenkataSubrahmanya Kumar Bhajana received his degrees B.E in Electronics and Communication engineering from Sapthagiri college of engineering Dharmapuri, Tamilnadu, India(University of Madras), in 2000, M.E from the P.S.N.A College of engineering and Technology, Dindigul, Tamilnadu,India under Anna University, Chennai in the year 2005 and PhD in Electrical Engineering from the Bharath University, Chennai, India in 2011. He has 11 years of teaching experience in various engineering institutes in India. He is previously associated as post-doc researcher at University of West Bohemia, Pilsen, Czech Republic during Aug 2013 to June 2015. He has collaborated with the Department of Electrical Machines and Drives, Lublin University of Technology, Lublin, Poland as a Visiting Professor.He is currently working as Associate Professor in the School of Electronics Engineering at KIIT University, Bhubaneswar, India since December 2011. He was currently being a reviewer for peer-reviewed journals like IEEE Transactions on Industrial Electronics , IEEE Journal of Emerging and Selected Topics in Power Electronics, IET Power Electronics ,International Journal of Circuit Theory and Applications ,International Transactions on Electrical Energy Systems.He has presented papers in most reputed IEEE international conferences are IECON, ISIE, ICIT, EPE-ECCE and PEDS. His key areas of interest are Power Electronics engineering, which includes soft switching DC to DC converters, AC‐AC converters, and multilevel converters.

name: Manoj Kumar Parida 2
bio:
Manoj Kumar Parida has been pursuing his doctoral degree from Indira Gandhi Centre for Atomic Research, Department of Atomic Energy, (HBNI-BARC Mumbai), India. In his research he has worked on Monte Carlo Simulations to optimize the geometrical parameters for Semiconductor Neutron detector in order to obtain the maximum efficiency of thermal neutrons. He has extensively worked on micro fabrications of cantilever using Photo Lithography tool. Along with alpha spectroscopy experienced on Si PIN diode, he has experienced of handling and performing the challenging neutron detection experiments. He has also performed electrical characterization of the Si PIN diode before and after neutron irradiation.
His area of research primarily focuses Interdisciplinary application of detector design and Charcoal Electronics. Manoj Kumar Parida has over five years of teaching/research experience. Currently he is also working on the project “Charcoal Based Low-Cost Smart Sensor for Agriculture Application”.

name: Dr Sushanta Kumar Mohapatra
bio: He received his B.E. from Utkal University, M.E. in Communication Control and Networking from MITS, Gwalior, in 1994 and 2003 respectively. He obtained Ph.D. from National Institute of Technology, Rourkela, in the year 2016. Currently he is working as Assistant Professor, in School of Electronics Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Bhubaneswar from 20th June 2016. He have more than 19 years of teaching experience. He had a teaching and administrative experience as an Assistance Professor and Head of the Department of ETC from Mar. 2001 to Jun. 2011 at A.B.I.T., Cuttack. Explore, share and learn interesting research opportunities on Nano-electronics devices, Sensors for Communication and RF Transceivers with application towards IoT in which my contributions will make a difference to the quality of life of real people.His research interests include Modeling and Simulation of Nanoscale Devices and its application in IoT. Energy efficient Wireless Sensor Networking, Adhoc Networks, Cellular Communications, Metamaterial absorbers in THz application, UWB-MIMO Antenna, Reconfigurable Antenna, Performance enhancement for high frequency applications. He has extensively contributed as author and co-author in several national and international journals and conferences of repute. He has been a part of committee member of various international conferences, Editorial Board Member and Reviewer of many international journals.

tab_details.Research Interests: Nanoscale Devices, Communication Systems, Networking, RF Applications

name: Dr Mano Ranjan Kumar
bio: Dr. Mano Ranjan Kumar is Ph.D. from National Institute of Technology, Raipur and presently working as Assistant Professor at School of Electronics Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneshwar, India. He had pursued M.E. and B.E. from Birla Institute of Technology Mesra, Ranchi and Bhilai Institute of Technology, Durg respectively. His research interest includes ultracapacitor modeling and characterizations, fractional-order system modeling & control and optimization techniques.
publications: 1. Mano Ranjan Kumar, Vishwa Deepak and Subhojit Ghosh, “Fractional order controller design in frequency domain using an improved nonlinear adaptive seeker optimization algorithm,” Turkish Journal of Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences, 25, 2017, pp. 4299-4310.

2. Mano Ranjan Kumar, Subhojit Ghosh and Shantanu Das, “Charge-discharge energy efficiency analysis of ultracapacitor with fractional-order dynamics using hybrid optimization and its experimental validation,” AEU – International Journal of Electronics and Communications, 78, 2017, pp. 274-280.

3. Mano Ranjan Kumar, Subhojit Ghosh and Shantanu Das, “Frequency dependent piecewise fractional-order modelling of ultracapacitors using hybrid optimization and fuzzy clustering”, Journal of Power Sources, 335, 2016, pp. 98-104.

4. Mano Ranjan Kumar, Subhojit Ghosh and Shantanu Das, “A hybrid optimization-based approach for parameter estimation and investigation of fractional dynamics in ultracapacitors”, Circuits, Systems and Signal Processing, 35, 2016, pp. 1949–1971.

5. Mano Ranjan Kumar and Subhojit Ghosh, "Hybrid Seeker Optimization Algorithm Based Fractional Order Controller Design in Frequency Domain with Experimental Validation,” In 3rd IFAC International Conference on Advances in Control and Optimization of Dynamical Systems (ACODS – 2018), DRDO, Hyderabad

6. Mano Ranjan Kumar, Subhojit Ghosh and Shantanu Das, “Analyzing the effect of charge/discharge profile on ultracapacitor performance using fractional calculus,” In International Conference on Advanced Rechargeable Batteries and Allied Materials (ICARBM – 2017), CMET Pune, 2017.

7. Mano Ranjan Kumar, Subhojit Ghosh and Shantanu Das, “Investigation of fractional dynamics and design of ultracapacitor based very low frequency oscillators,” In IEEE Annual India Conference (INDICON – 2016), IISc Bangalore, 2016.

8. Mano Ranjan Kumar, Subhojit Ghosh and Shantanu Das, “Identification of fractional order circuits from frequency response data using seeker optimization algorithm,” In IEEE International Conference on Industrial Instrumentation and Control (ICIC – 2015), College of Engineering, Pune, 2015.

9. Lalitesh Kumar, Subhojit Ghosh, Mano Ranjan Kumar, "A Multiobjective Based Optimization Approach for Robustness Recovery of a LQG Compensator," In Indian Control Conference (ICC – 2015), IIT Madras, Chennai.
